div.div: YCS Remote Learning Plan Set to Launch Next Week.

span.span: A letter from Dr. Carlos Lopez, Assistant Superintendent of YCS, regarding the YCS Remote Learning Plan set to launch next week. This plan clearly outlines the specific details about formal instruction to YCS students based on the Executive Order of Governor Whitmer.
Also, you will find a YCS Continuity of Learning FAQ sheet that provides questions and answers to distance learning.
Thank you, and have a great weekend!
YCS Remote Learning Plan-April 27, 2020
Y
CS Continuity of Learning FAQ

div.h3:
Ypsilanti Community Schools
Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response Plan

span.span: District News -
Greetings YCS Families:

This week the Ypsilanti Community Schools (YCS) district received the great news that the Washtenaw Intermediate School District (WISD) has approved our Continuity of Learning Plan under the executive orders of Governor Whitmer. This approval means we can officially begin to implement online learning and show all the hard work that has been done over the last four weeks by the administration, principals, teachers, and staff.

Our first component is to process all iPads and Chromebooks for student pickup and also make sure that families in need of internet access have been set-up to begin online learning. This process will start with a message from the district and building principals in the coming days on the details of the outlined plan.

If you missed it, last week, Superintendent Alena Zachery-Ross launched a video that has garnered over 1,000 views on Facebook and another 900 on the website. You will see more video messaging throughout the remainder of the school year to have transparent communication with YCS staff, families, and communities.
Please find Superintendent Alena Zachery-Ross Week of April 19th
video message
Information was shared earlier this week regarding
every
YCS student receiving an EBT/SNAP card to help supplement food during this emergency closure. For families who already receive benefits, the funds will apply to your current card. For families that
do not
have an EBT/SNAP card, one will be mailed to your household for each child ages 5-18. The card will provide money for March, April, May, and June. Please see
link for official press release/
YCS Food Distribution days are now scheduled for Thursday's only at ten (10) different site locations in the Ypsilanti/Willow Run area. Please visit
www.ycschools.us
for more information. Each week we will now give out more than 42,000 breakfast and lunch meals for seven days.
Finally, on a super positive note! The YCSH Boys Basketball team was featured on
FoxSports Detroit program Earn the Letter
on Wednesday, April 15th! This 10-minute segment highlighted the F.A.M.I.L.Y mantra the team has under the leadership of Coach Steven Brooks. Congratulations on a competitive season!
The district is continuing to work hard to service all YCS students and families during this emergency closure.

To help YCS workers and volunteers stay safe in the Food Services Department, YCS Food Distribution will now be on Thursdays only. We will have ten (10) site locations for food distribution. The site times will remain the same with distribution from 11:00am.-1:00pm. and specific locations** from 4:00 - 6:00pm.in partnership with Food Gathers.

span.strong: This change will begin effective this week (4/13)! There will be no food distribution on Tuesday's.

h4.strong: If you can volunteer, click on the link below:

span.span: Please find a link to an information sheet for the state-issued Pandemic EBT Program.
This change allows us to distribute 42,000 meals per week versus the 20,000 in previous weeks. The additional sites will also allow for a broader range of locations for families to easily access.

ol.li: A.C.C.E. School / 11:00am-1:00pm / 1076 Ecorse Rd, Ypsilanti, MI 48198
Arbor One Apartments / 11:00am-1:00pm / 799 Green Rd, Ypsilanti, MI 48198
Christian Love Fellowship / 11:00am-1:00pm / 1601 Stamford Rd, Superior Charter Twp, MI 48198)
Erickson Elementary School / 11:00am-1:00pm / 1427 Levona St, Ypsilanti, MI 48198
Holmes Elementary School / 11:00am-1:00pm / 1255 Holmes Rd. Ypsilanti, MI 48198.
Parkridge Community Center / 11:00am-1:00pm / 591 Armstrong Dr, Ypsilanti, MI 48197**

span.span: Strong Tower Ministries /11:00am-1:00pm /134 Spencer, Ln., Ypsilanti, Mi 48198i**

ol.li: Sycamore Meadows / 11:00am-1:00pm : / 1273 Stamford Ct, Ypsilanti, MI 48198
West Willow Area - CRC Community Resource Center / 11:00am-1:00pm / 2057 Tyler Rd. Ypsilanti 48198
Ypsilanti Community High School / 11:00am-1:00pm / 2095 Packard Rd Ypsilanti, MI 48197

span.span: **4:00-6:00p.m. Food Distribution with Food Gatherers boxes - 2 Sites Only

ol.li: Parkridge Community Center / 4:00-6:00pm / 591 Armstrong Dr, Ypsilanti, MI 48197**

span.span: Strong Tower Ministries / 4:00-6:00pm /134 Spencer, Ln., Ypsilanti, Mi 48198i**
Food Gatherers is a YCS Community Partner who is providing the food boxes but not managing the sites. YCS volunteers are the ones leading the sites along with YCS Food Services Department
Meal pickups are free of charge to all children. Children do not need to be enrolled at a YCS school.
As a reminder, all YCS Food Distribution days will now be on Thursdays only!

div.span: When: Every Saturday at 10;30 am - 12:00 pm -- *4th Saturday 11:30 am - 1:00 pm -- March 21, March 28*, April 4, 11, 18, 25*, May 2, 9, 16, 23*, 30, June 6, 13, 20 & 27*

a.title: View more about YCS Board of Education with Live Stream
a.aria-label: YCS Board of Education with Live Stream

div.a: YCS Board of Education with Live Stream

div.div: YCS Board of Education with Live Stream

Board and Cabinet should use the Join Hangouts Meet link in this message to join:
Hangouts Meet link for Board and Cabinet: https://meet.google.com/kbg-neih-rjg?hs=122
Members of the public should use the following link to watch the live stream:
View only live stream link for public: https://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_Stream
When asked to log in from the link above, members of the public should pick a two-digit number between 00 and 99, and log in using one of the accounts created for this purpose:
Usernames: public00@ycschools.us through public99@ycschools.us
Password: ycspublic
Anyone from the public can register their attendance at the following link. If they would like to ask a question or make a public comment to the board, there is a place for that, as well:
Live form: http://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_Comments
As public comments come in, they will be collected in the order received in the following spreadsheet. Board and Cabinet are the only ones with access:
Formatted Public Comments: https://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_FormattedComments
Sheet Collecting Attendance and Comments: http://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_PublicCommentsCollected
This event has a video call. Join: https://meet.google.com/kbg-neih-rjg +1 929-282-0832 PIN: 274727173#

Calendar: YCS District Calendar
Board and Cabinet should use the Join Hangouts Meet link in this message to join:
Hangouts Meet link for Board and Cabinet: https://meet.google.com/kbg-neih-rjg?hs=122
Members of the public should use the following link to watch the live stream:
View only live stream link for public: https://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_Stream
When asked to log in from the link above, members of the public should pick a two-digit number between 00 and 99, and log in using one of the accounts created for this purpose:
Usernames: public00@ycschools.us through public99@ycschools.us
Password: ycspublic
Anyone from the public can register their attendance at the following link. If they would like to ask a question or make a public comment to the board, there is a place for that, as well:
Live form: http://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_Comments
As public comments come in, they will be collected in the order received in the following spreadsheet. Board and Cabinet are the only ones with access:
Formatted Public Comments: https://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_FormattedComments
Sheet Collecting Attendance and Comments: http://bit.ly/YCS_BOE_PublicCommentsCollected

div.h2: WIMA & WIHI Application Process and Dates

div.h3: WIMA & WIHI Application Process and Dates

br.a:
Washtenaw International Middle Academy
Application Process for the 2020 - 2021 School Year

Washtenaw International High School
Application Process for the 2020 - 2021 School Year

div.p: As an International Baccalaureate (IB) partner school with Washtenaw International Middle Academy (WIMA), we want to share important dates and details about the 6th-grade WIMA Application Process for the 2020-2021 school year. We hope you can join us at the WIMA Admissions Info Night on January 8th @ 6pm where you can learn about WIMA's caring, diverse, and academically-focused learning community! The application opens tomorrow, Friday, November 8th and closes February 7th. For more information about WIMA&WIHI, please visit our website (wihi.org) and view this informational video.

YIES students who apply prior to the deadline have priority into WIMA after siblings (State Policy) are admitted. Since we have limited seats (64 total), we will likely have a lottery for the seats available for WIMA 6th grade students. Please review the dates and application details attached and contact admissions coordinator, Kelly Cartwright (KCartwright@wihi.org) with any questions.
We look forward to welcoming you to our school community!

Nhu Do, Principal
Program Director, Washtenaw Educational Options Consortium

div.h2: Enrichment Packets for Preschool to 8th Grade
Enrichment Packets for Preschool to 8th Grade

img.br: Enrichment packets are in PDF format and can be downloaded and printed. These are the same packets passed out at the YCS Food Distribution Sites.

p.a: Link to Enrichment Packets to download

div.div: Enrichment packets are still available at most food distribution sites or online at www.ycschools.us.

div.p: Link to Resources During the COVID-19 Outbreak - English | Link to Resources During the COVID-19 Outbreak - Arabic | Link to Resources During the COVID-19 Outbreak - Spanish
div.div: TRAILS Tips for Supporting Student Wellness at Home

div.p: RAHS Clinics are able to provide over the phone counseling services to students (and/or get them connected to needed resources) at phone number 734-998-2163. Washtenaw County CMH is also available for mental health support of families at 734-544-3050.

In addition, we are creating a guide to support staff self-care strategies during this difficult time and compiling resources that school staff can share directly with students to support student development and use of coping skills. If you find there are other mental health components we can provide and promote, please don't hesitate to let me know.

p.a: Link to Tips for supporting student wellness

p.br: A new child care program opened this summer at the former Chapelle Community School, an elementary school within the Ypsilanti Community Schools District at 111 South Wallace Boulevard, Ypsilanti, MI 48197.

div.p: Registration forms may be found here. For more information about touring the facility, please contact Lee Anna Pasker-Edens at lpasker@annarborymca.org or 734.661.8058.
The Collaborative – Ypsilanti YMCA Child Development Center (CDC) addresses a critical need for excellent quality, affordable child care in eastern Washtenaw County.

div.h3: Regional Alliance for Healthy Schools - University of Michigan for Healthy Schools
Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1975
div.p: Ypsilanti Community Schools is in full compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1975, which prohibits discrimination on the basis of disability in District programs, services, and activities. The District's policy manual for Section 504 can be found on the District's website.

Daily substitutes are now at a $100/day rate and can contact EduStaff directly for the application process.
www.edustaff.org or 877-974-6338

img.a: 2014-15 District Annual Education Report (AER) Cover Letter

span.span: Ypsilanti,
MI

div.p: The purpose of YCS is to develop mindful, engaged students with the skill set, work ethic, and attitude to contribute to a community that honors diversity, equality and justice.

YCS is — Academically strong and committed to transforming in ways that help students thrive.
YCS is —The choice for a trusted, reliable and socially just district.
YCS is —A sense of connection for families' and students' in a district where each and everyone is valued and belongs.
YCS is — Your consistently well-managed and organized school district.
